page.title: 19MR. GREENLEAVES (3)
page.content: Frodsham had a busy station, trains went to many places _ busier than today. The other odes of transport were horse and cart and on foot. The area within Frodsham was much more rural, High St., Main St., Church St. and Fluin Lane were the only main roads. Shops were found in Main St. and Church St. these being small businesses _ 3 people in a shop made a crowd! Rigby's Dairy and Hanbury's were cinemas, entrance 1 penny! Streets had no electric lights but gas lights were lit by a man each evening with a long pole. Local farms were dairy farms producing milk for local consumption. There were more public houses than today. The market was a more prominent feature remaining open until 8pm.
